document.docAuthor: Pikart, Tiago G., Costa, Valmir A., Hansson, Christer, De Cristo, Sandra C. & Vitorino, Marcelo D.
document.masterDocTitle: A survey for potential biological control agents of Pereskia aculeata Miller (Cactaceae) in Brazil reveals two new species of Horismenus Walker (Hymenoptera: Eulophidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A survey for potential biological control agents of Pereskia aculeata Miller (Cactaceae) in Brazil reveals two new species of Horismenus Walker (Hymenoptera: Eulophidae)

heading.emphasis:
Horismenus elisae Pikart
, Costa & Hansson, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material. Holotype female (MZSP) point mounted, with label “BRASIL-SC-Itajaí, [26°54'29"S, 48°39'43"W], Ex
Adetus analis
em
Pereskia aculeata
, col. SC Cristo, 10.vi.2013 ”. Paratypes. 6♀ (3♀ MZSP, 3♀ BMNH) with same label data as holotype.
One specimen with head, without antennae, glued separately to the point. Some specimens with expanded gaster and/or ballooned wings.

Similar to
Horismenus steirastomae (Girault)
, but with upper frons with engraved reticulation and with two areas of raised reticulation running from frontal suture to anterior ocellus ( Fig. 8 , arrows), malar sulcus present ( Fig. 7 , arrow), mesoscutum and scutellum with stronger reticulation ( Fig. 10 ) and different color ( Fig. 2 ). Also similar to
H. vitorinoi
, described herein, but with scutellum shiny black ( Fig. 2 ), midlobe of mesoscutum with strong and raised reticulation only anterolaterally and remaining parts with engraved reticulation ( Fig. 10 ), scutellum with weaker reticulation ( Fig. 10 ), propodeum with median carina narrower and submedian grooves wider ( Fig. 11 ), fore wing with fewer admarginal setae, and gaster with first tergite shorter and less reticulate ( Fig. 12 , arrows).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–6.
Horismenus
spp., females. 1–2 ,
H. elisae
, paratype: 1 , habitus, lateral; 2 , mesosoma, dorsal. 3–4 ,
H. vitorinoi
, paratype: 3 , habitus, lateral; 4 , mesosoma, dorsal. 5 ,
H. elisae
, paratype, vertex, showing two black areas (white arrows). 6 ,
H. vitorinoi
, paratype, vertex, showing two black areas (white arrows). Scale bars: 1 , 3 = 500 µm; 2 , 4–6 = 100 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Head. Antenna as in Fig. 9 . Frons ( Fig. 8 ) with interscrobal area smooth and shiny, lower frons with raised and strong reticulation, area just above frontal suture smooth and shiny to very weakly reticulate, upper frons engravedreticulate with two areas of raised reticulation running from frontal suture to anterior ocellus ( Fig. 8 , arrows), clypeal area very weakly reticulate, area below antennal toruli weakly reticulate; frontal suture V-shaped and not reaching eyes; antennal scrobes joining below frontal suture. Malar sulcus present ( Fig. 7 , arrow). Vertex with engraved reticulation ( Fig. 8 ); median groove indicated posteriorly. Occipital margin rounded.

Metasoma. Petiole dorsomedially with a weak and narrow, smooth longitudinal carina. Gaster with first tergite 0.9× as long as wide, smooth and shiny and with a reticulate band close to posterior margin ( Fig. 12 , arrows).
Ratios. DE/DO 5.2; WH/DE 1.8; HE/MS/WM 2.4/1.0/1.3; POL/OOL/POO 8.8/3.0/1.0; WH/WT 1.2; LW/LM/ HW 1.8/1.2/1.0; PM/ST 1.1; LC/WC 3.7; WG/WC 1.1; LS/LT 0.2; LP/WP 0.9; MM/LG 0.7.
Etymology. Named after Elisa Ciriaco de Cristo Bernabé, daughter of the fourth author (SCC).

Hosts. Specimens reared from larvae of
Adetus analis
( Coleoptera : Cerambycidae ) on
Pereskia aculeata
( Cactaceae ).
